name: Rentbot
tagline: Automatic rent management : manages bills for you & your room-mates
body:
### Rentbot
Rentbot is a simple solution that tries to auto parse your email-bills and then send out en email to every romm-mate at the end of the month. 

**It is currently still in development & needs a lot of improvement**

### Example topology 
    <rentbot>
	
	<bill name="rent" fixed="2000.0">
		<user name="John" ratio="0.55"/>
		<user name="Adam" ratio="0.45" />
	</bill>

	<bill name="cox" from_email="Do_Not_Reply_Prod@cox.com">
		<user name="John" ratio="0.50"/>
		<user name="Adam" ratio="0.50" />
	</bill>

	<bill name="sdge" from_email="do-not-reply@sdge.com">
		<user name="John" ratio="0.50"/>
		<user name="Adam" ratio="0.50" />
	</bill>


	<bill name="erenterplan" from_email="support@leasingdesk.com">
		<user name="John" ratio="0.50"/>
		<user name="Adam" ratio="0.50" />
	</bill>

    </rentbot>

#### Explanation
Each bill has a name & either a 'fixed' tag or a 'from_email' tag. 
  - fixed: use the actual value
  - from_email: looks through emails received from this specific host & try to extract the $ amount.

Each bill also contains different people that owe money to that payment of this bill. This is called a user.
They are simply defined by their name & how much of the bill that need to pay (as a ratio)

### Required Permissions
If you do not want this program to read your email then feel free to use the static portions or extend a file handler class.
Your information is safely stored on your computer using secure AES encryption along with a bcrypt salted hash. You will require a password to enter the program, so pick an intelligent password.

### Licensing
Feel free to use this product at your own discrecion. No assurances are provided & it is given under an MIT license. If you do use this somewhere please just list this page somewhere: http://github.com/jramapuram/rentbot (@jramapuram).
